H0.text: They are made of the same materials is the best description of the relationship between Mars, an inner planet, and Jupiter, an outer planet.

H1.text: They orbit the Sun in opposite directions is the relationship between Mars, an inner planet, and Jupiter, an outer planet.

H2.text: They have the same orbital periods around the Sun is the best description of the relationship between Mars, an inner planet, and Jupiter, an outer planet.

H3.text: They are located on opposite sides of the asteroid belt, with Mars being an inner planet and Jupiter being an outer planet.

A4.text: The asteroid belt is a torus-shaped region in the Solar System, centered on the Sun and roughly spanning the space between the orbits of the planets Jupiter and Mars.

A5.text: In 1596, Johannes Kepler wrote, 'Between Mars and Jupiter, I place a planet,' in his Mysterium Cosmographicum, stating his prediction that a planet would be found there.
